works.title: JavaScript
works.description: JavaScript (JS) is essential for modern web development, providing dynamic behavior and interactive features for web applications.

works.title: Node.js
works.description: Node.js is a powerful runtime that allows JavaScript to be executed server-side, enabling scalable and efficient backend solutions.

works.title: React
works.description: React is a popular front-end library for building user interfaces, known for its component-based architecture and fast rendering.

works.title: MongoDB
works.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents, making it ideal for scalable and fast data retrieval.

works.title: Express.js
works.description: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides robust features for web and mobile applications.

works.title: TypeScript
works.description: TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript, enhancing code quality and development productivity.

works.title: Redux
works.description: Redux is a state management tool commonly used with React for managing and centralizing application state.

works.title: Next.js
works.description: Next.js is a React framework for building server-side rendered and static web applications, providing improved SEO and performance.

works.title: HTML
works.description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating the structure of web pages.

works.title: CSS
works.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used for styling and designing the layout of web pages, enhancing the visual presentation.
